title: 3 Ways to Change the Language on HBO Max

steps.title: Start watching something on Max.
steps.content: Start watching something on Max. You can use either your computer, TV, or the mobile app on your phone or tablet to watch something on Max.

steps.title: Select the Audio and Subtitles icon.
steps.content: Select the Audio and Subtitles icon. It's the squared chat bubble icon with two lines on it at the bottom-right corner of the screen (on a computer or TV) and at the top-right on a phone or tablet. This icon may be a boxed "cc" on some platforms. If you're using the mobile app and don't see the icon, tap the screen first. If you're using a TV, you can pause the video or press another button on the remote (like the down arrow) to see this icon. If you're using a computer, move the mouse or click the window to find the icon.

steps.title: Select a subtitle language.
steps.content: Select a subtitle language. If subtitles are available in a different language for the current show or movie, you can select that language under the "Subtitles" heading. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Select an audio language.
steps.content: Select an audio language. If you see other languages under the "Audio" heading, you can select a different language for the current show or movie here. If you don't see the language you want, it's not available for that content. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open Max.
steps.content: Open Max. You can do this using your TV, a web browser, or the mobile app. Max will automatically play movies and shows to match your display language. You can use this method to change that language. [3] X Research source Not all languages are available.

steps.title: Open your Settings.
steps.content: Open your Settings. The steps to get there are a little different depending on your device: Phone or tablet: Tap your profile photo at the upper-right corner and then tap the gear icon. TV (like a Roku): Tap the gear icon. Computer: Click your profile icon at the upper-right corner and select Settings .

steps.title: Select Display Language.
steps.content: Select Display Language . This is called Edit my Display Language on a TV, but Display Language on other devices. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Navigate to your language settings.
steps.content: Navigate to your language settings. The steps for this vary depending on the device you're using: Phone or tablet: Tap your profile icon (upper right corner), then tap the "Settings" icon (it looks like a gear), and tap Display Language . TV (like a Roku): Select the "Settings" icon (it's a gear), then choose Edit my Display Language . Computer: Click your profile icon (upper right corner), then choose Settings > Display Language > Change Language .

steps.title: Click Change language (computer only).
steps.content: Click Change language (computer only). You can skip this step on other platforms.

steps.title: Select a language.
steps.content: Select a language. All the languages you can choose from will be displayed here. If you don't see the language you want, it's not supported yet.

steps.title: Open Max.
steps.content: Open Max. You'll be able to do this easily whether you're using the site on your computer or your TV.

steps.title: Search International movies.
steps.content: Search International movies. Choose the menu icon (upper left of your browser window) or the Browse icon on your TV, and then select International . [5] X Research source These movies will play with the original audio and English subtitles instead of playing a dubbed version.

steps.title: Search Latino movies to find programming in Spanish or Portuguese.
steps.content: Search Latino movies to find programming in Spanish or Portuguese. Choose the menu icon (upper left of your browser window) or the Browse icon on your TV, and then select Latino . [6] X Research source These movies will play in their original Spanish or Portuguese languages with English subtitles.
